documents.document: I can't wait to buy autumnal cosy jumpers! 🍁

@dressingupwith Oh really! 🤔 I quite like the sounds of a head massage!
RT @ChanceFrom79th: canceling plans to read is ok. skipping a party for the gym is ok. staying home to cook is ok. lets encourage it & resp…
@hayleyjoeann I'm quite thrifty with buying clothes and things! I'm always on the look out for voucher codes or discounts in magazines! 🙈
@hayleyjoeann I don't mind spending it on gigs, holidays etc because they are all good experiences! 😊
@hayleyjoeann Haha! Thanks! I do wish I could afford to save more for the long term...but I know that I'm spending my savings on good experiences!
@hayleyjoeann Yeah I try to put away £200 a month! Quite often that ends up spent on weekends away etc. So I'm not really saving for long term! 😕
@hayleyjoeann I don't think I could live without a weekly budget. I'm a very planned person and like to have everytging worked out to the penny! 🙈
@hayleyjoeann Mostly! I've just done a Tesco online order and now only have £15 until Friday! Haha!😕 But if I have all my food then what do I really need?
RT @Little_Fickle: ALL. JOBS. ARE. REAL. JOBS.
@hayleyjoeann If I manage to use less money then I'll put the extra in my savings account!
@hayleyjoeann I budget myself £100 a week but that includes transport, food, any clothes/make-up/toiletries eating out, coffees, gym classes etc.
When I go to Stobo should I get a hot stone massage or a indian head & face massage?? 🤔 Hmmm! 😕
